meanings.definition: The practice or characteristic of being a eunuch.
meanings.sent1: His eunuchisms were evident in his gentle demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The eunuchisms of the palace staff were refined and polite.
meanings.sent3: The eunuchisms of the choir conductor made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her eunuchisms in negotiation were like a calm river flowing.
meanings.sent5: The eunuchisms of the monk were a model of serenity.

meanings.definition: The language or mannerisms typical of eunuchs.
meanings.sent1: She mimicked the eunuchisms of the courtiers with precision.
meanings.sent2: The eunuchisms of the old servant were endearing to all.
meanings.sent3: His eunuchisms in speech always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The eunuchisms of the butler were like a well-rehearsed play.
meanings.sent5: The eunuchisms of the gardener were as soothing as a gentle breeze.
